raw: Ben Nelms OTTAWA ( Reuters ) - Canada posted a wider - than - expected trade deficit of C$ 1.47 billion ( $ 1.10 billion ) in January , largely on lower exports of motor vehicles and parts , official data showed on Friday .
replaced: Statscan posted the December deficit in January , largely on lower exports of motor vehicles and parts , official data showed on Friday .

raw: Analysts polled by Reuters had forecast a shortfall of C$ 830 million .
replaced: Analysts polled by Reuters had forecast a shortfall of C$ 830 million .

raw: Statscan revised the December deficit up to C$ 732 million from an initial C$ 370 million .
replaced: Statscan revised the December deficit up to C$ 732 million from an initial C$ 370 million .

raw: The value of exports fell by 2.0 % in January , the largest decline reported since the 5.6 % decline in June 2019 , to C$ 48.14 billion , with 9 of the 11 product sections tracked by Statscan posting declines .

raw: Imports dropped by 0.5 % , with declines seen in six of the 11 product sections .
replaced: Imports dropped by 0.5 % , with declines seen in six of the 11 product sections .

raw: Canada ’s central bank slashed a key interest rate on Wednesday by half a percentage point , the most in more than a decade , as it worked to try and protect Canada ’s economy from a coronavirus outbreak and said it was prepared to ease further if needed .

raw: Canadian monthly exports to China declined 7.8 % in January , with lower exports of gold , potash and wood pulp reported , the agency said , while imports fell 12.1 % , mainly on lower cellphone imports .

raw: Canadian exports to the United States dropped 1.7 % , mainly because of the lower passenger car and truck shipments .
